name: Hilton Garden Inn Atlanta Perimeter Center

reviews.text: This was the perfect hotel for our two night stay in Atlanta. It was just outside of Atlanta, right on the highway so it was very convenient. We did not use the pool or gym. Our room was very spacious and clean, the bed was comfortable, the service was okay. Their buffet breakfast is perfect for a quick breakfast. The only big downfall is their parking. It is up on the hill so no easy access to it and for loading and unloading your luggage you are pretty much in everyones way since the driveway at the front is very small.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel Close Enough To Atlanta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price: I am not aware of what the usual price for this hotel would be, because I purchased it via Priceline’s “name your price” option. I submitted a bid of $40 and was so surprised when I received the result that this hotel accepted my bid! For the quality (and brand) received, it was a hell of a deal.
reviews.title: Great Quality, Even Better Value

reviews.text: Parking: The parking was extremely odd, being that it was a very steep hill adjacent to the hotel, while the hotel was below this hill. Getting to the hotel required a sharp walk
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel

reviews.text: Down the hill or by means of stairs that was located in the parking lot as well. However, the lot was well lit so there weren’t many concerns for safety. Also, the main entrance to the hotel is a one-way street, which can cause for some inconvenience. However, I don’t think many guests realized (due to the some negative comments about the entrance) that the parking lot had a second entrance/exit as well, which places traffic back on to Ashford-Dunwoody Road without any problems. That way, circling around the business complex in order to get back on to the main road is absolutely not necessary.
reviews.title: Solid choice for Atlanta Perimeter area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff: very nice! Again, for the price, I received great quality. While check-in is at 3 PM, I came in around 9 AM. The guest attendant joked around about me being “too early” for check in, however, he went ahead and serviced me as a convenience, which I really appreciated. The staff is very cordial and helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was nice for what we paid. We booked the "getaway package" that included breakfast. I am glad we did, because the breakfast buffet, priced at $11.95, would not have been worth it. It was OK, but not worth $11.95! The hotel was very close to a mall, a MARTA station, and the interstate. Our room was nice and clean. The desk employees were very helpful. Nice place!
reviews.title: Nice hotel- very convenient for the price!

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel several times previously, liked the location and had no prior complaints, but on this trip, we found out that our loyalty was not important. We booked two rooms for three nights through Hotels.com. What we found out upon arrival is there is no guarantee the hotel will assign rooms as booked. They placed us in SMOKING rooms on a SMOKING floor. The odor in the rooms was very strong. We asked for different rooms, but they stated the hotel was full. We asked about the possibility of being moved to a non-smoking room the next day. They told us no non-smoking rooms were available, nor would any non-smoking rooms be available the next day. We were able to find a room for part of our group at a different hotel. My wife and I had to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn for one night before moving to the different motel the next night. The odor and feel of smoke residue in the room was terrible and we both woke up with sore throats. When checking out that morning, we noticed others also checking out. We again asked about the availability of a non-smoking room. We were told the hotel was full no non-smoking room available. We felt as though our loyalty was not important and that our business, because it had been booked through Hotels.com, did not carry the same weight as someone booking directly with the hotel. We felt as though we were "second class". They have lost our business, but based on how "unimportant" we felt, I don't think it will matter to this hotel.
reviews.title: Very Dissapointed With Our Treatment

reviews.text: Hotel room carpet was in bad shape but overall good hotel. Pool/ Jacuzzi was great. Bar and lobby was great. Parking is strange, it is up on a steep hill. However do not make a phone call from their phone. My teenage daughter slept in while we explore some tourist attractions and she called from the hotel to tell us she had left her phone in the car, less than a minute call and we were charged over $7 for that call. Complained at check out but clerk wouldn't reduce the charge. We had early morning plans and with the bar open late we heard loud drunks fighting in the hallway around 1am.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with only minor issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I were taking a short anniversary trip to Atlanta, because I have never visited before & also because we were visiting with relatives on the way. I had done some extensive research on hotels before choosing this one. This hotel had a great price rate, reviews, & photos, so we thought we would give it a shot. We were VERY glad we did! The location of the hotel was very convienient to all the things we had planned to do, such as the Georgia Aquarium, The World of Coca-Cola, the CNN studio tour, & the local malls. We didn't do a whole lot of other venturing out, because the weather wasn't too great & traffic was horrible! One night we stayed in & ate at the restaurant inside the hotel, which was GREAT! The server was very friendly, along with all the hotel staff. We also ordered room service one night & was fast & great as well. Checking in & out was fast & easy. Our room was so cozy & clean. We loved the large flat tv & the complimentary Wifi. We locked our key in the room by accident once, & the guy at the front desk was so nice about giving us another. The only downfall (and it wasnt a huge downfall for us but may be for others) is there was only one pool which was indoors and it was small & so was the fitness center (there were several people using both) & also the parking. Parking was at the top of a steep hill behind the hotel. We were ok with walking, but it might be a problem for someone else. We did however unload our luggage at the front, took it up, & then parked, which worked out great for us. Overall, this place was great, & we would DEFINITELY stay here again if we ever visited Atlanta again in the future.
reviews.title: Great For A Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: Stayed here 3 nites with family in the late of Dec 2009. Hilton Garden left me a very good impression from the first time I entered the lobby. Our check-in was quick and simple. Especially there were freshly baked cookies offered to every customer for free along with tea and coffee. Our room was clean, nice decorated with a super comfortable room. The staffs were all friendly and welcoming. The location was also fabulous, close to Perimeter SC and high way. Some people may claim about the one way street but it didn’t mind me at all. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: This is an airport hotel that has practically nothing within walking distance except other hotels, and it's not a real walk-friendly area anyway. The staff was nice, the hotel had a good shuttle service, and a decent fitness room/pool/hot tub set-up. My flight got in late. When I called, the shuttle came quickly and my registration form and keys were waiting for at the front desk, which is a nice touch after midnight. Although the pool and hot tub were closed, the front desk manager let me use the hot tub before bed.
reviews.title: Good rooms, good service, mediocre location, bad restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was pretty standard for the brand, which is ok, because HGI's are generally a solid value. The free hot breakfast was a disappointment. I ordered room service one night and it was so bad I barely touched it. If you stay there, eat elsewhere!
reviews.title: Superb Hotel with Fabulous Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel and we got it for $68 a night, which was fabo! We even got a free first morning breakfast buffet for 2 even though we didn't opt for that on our reservations. It only has one detractor as some have mentioned. Parking for this hotel is on an upper level and the climb is either approx 40 steep curving steps or steep grade walk up. It is definitely non overweight people, disabled or physically challenged in anyway. I am an obese woman and couldn't do it but if you aren't challenged in any way you will be ok. There are 6 handicap spaces next to the hotel for those who have tags all others are towed away at owners expense; $125 tow and $15 a day storage. Other than that, the hotel is top notch and one of the best we have stayed in. One crazy thing about this hotel is the way in which you get to it, but keep your eyes peeled and you will be ok when you exit. It is located about 12 miles from Turner Field, about 8-10 miles from the edges of downtown and only a couple miles from grocery, fast food, drug store, etc shopping. You cannot go wrong booking this hotel, it is clean, friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast buffet with hot food, and convenient to most things without being in the most congested and noisy areas.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: This is the hotel where we had the best mattresses. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was very good. The staff was very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Deal if You Can Get It!

reviews.text: Booked a 3 night stay via Expedia. There was a special sale on New Years and was able to book a room for $65/night. Pretty good considering a room is $100+. Overall I enjoyed our stay here. It's not that difficult to get to, once you get off the nearby highway you make that immediate right onto Lake Hearn Drive, but it is a bit annoying to get out because it's a one way road around office complexes so you have to have GPS or study the map beforehand to circle back onto the main road.
reviews.title: Value but not great

reviews.text: From the time of my confirmation in October, I knew this hotel would be good. Having snagged a great deal- $90 for two nights through hotels.com, I called the hotel to get directions to the hotel from the airport. The customer service agent who answered the phone was so courteous and even accommodated my request to get double beds to accommodate colleagues who were staying with me the first night. The agent was also knowledgeable about how to use the metro to get to the property and was quite detailed in his instructions.
reviews.title: A little gem on the outskirt of Atlanta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my December visit, I arrived at the property at approximately 1am for check-in and while only a skeleton staff was on duty, my check-in lasted maybe only two minutes. The only drawback is that on seeing three ladies struggling with suitcases, the agent could have least brought the cart out to the front door. Other than, that we went up to the room, which while not large was in very good condition.
reviews.title: Super Thin Walls

reviews.text: The room we had had two double beds and had microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Being at a seminar, it helped that I had wireless internet which worked quite fine for me on the second floor. The bathroom was clean and well equipped and the overall presentation of the room was good even thought the room was not overly spacious.
reviews.title: Did our mattress come from a summer camp?

reviews.text: Having read other reviews about the bed being hard, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the bed simply felt like most hotel beds, so unless you were going more up market like the Renaissance, I maintain that the bed was quite in order. I must also speak to the "steep climb" to the parking lot that others spoke of. By simply leaving out suitcases at the front lobby, we parked and didn't find it a major hassle. However, if you have elderly persons traveling with you they might have a problem with the stairs to come down from the parking lot.
reviews.title: Hotel okay Restaurant unpredictable"
Excellent!
reviews.text: The hotel has excellent shuttle service within 3 miles and I was able to utilize the service to get lunch at Chilli's and would have been able to go any of the other 60 places within 3 miles as indicated on the list that the hotel so courteously provided. When I ad to leave the hotel, the shuttle dropped me off at the Medical Center station from which I took one train straight into the airport terminal- no hassles no stress and only $2.50 for the trip back to the airport.

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Atlanta Perimeter Hotel Atlanta
